page.title: 14The Caravan Site
page.content: There have been caravans on the site for 3O years. There are 4O in the winter and 2O in the summer. All are occupied by show people. Lorries pull the caravans. The show people travel around the North of England and some to Scotland. The furthest they go in England is to Leeds and Stokesley, and in Scotland to Glasgow. All the people are related to each other. The settled people, who live on the site all year, have central heating run on solid fuel. They have a water supply plumbed in. All the caravans have electricity with ordinary meters and most have flush toilets. The land at Choppington belongs to the Showmans Guild. A Caretaker collects the rent.
